quotes.name: Cato
quotes.quote: Bitter are the roots of study, but how sweet is their fruit.

quotes.name: Epictetus
quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

quotes.name: Epictetus
quotes.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.

quotes.name: Epictetus
quotes.quote: How long can you afford to put off who you really want to be? Your nobler self cannot wait any longer. Decide to be extraordinary and do what you need to do now.

quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: Just because something is hard to master, do not think it is humanly impossible, but, if a thing is humanly possible, consider it within your reach.

quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: Because other people are fools, must you be so too?

quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.

quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions â€” not outside.

quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.

quotes.name: Ryan Holiday
quotes.quote: We must remember, there is no easy way.

quotes.name: Seneca
quotes.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

quotes.name: Seneca
quotes.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

quotes.name: Seneca
quotes.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind as labor does the body.

quotes.name: Seneca
quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.

quotes.name: Unknown
quotes.quote: Learning is a daily thing, wisdom an endless pursuit.

quotes.name: Thomas Edison
quotes.quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

quotes.name: Zeno of Citium
quotes.quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is so we should listen more and talk less.
